tweets.html:
Morning! So…I saw an NYT features piece on Viola Davis and thought I'd say a couple things about it bc Shondaland is my trigger.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Here's the article: http://t.co/c8inUAaTpJ

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

1) Viola and the writer of the article seem confident that this leading role will not be anti-mammy. Time will tell.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Mostly time will tell because the role was written first and then she was thought about to audition which means…

a loose fitted blindcast.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Now, it's impt to note that there is more than just one "stereotype" that Viola needs to avoid in order for this "complex character" to

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

wander "free" in the Shonda universe where race is physical and/or is only a lasting issue from ppl who make it one.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Remember: PHC lists a few controlling images: "the lady," "Jezebel," "Matriarch" and "Welfare Queen" there are a lot of roads this could go.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

And tying that w Hall's formation of how stereotypes are a regime of representation that never die but recirculate and layer upon each other

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

(this is why there is no positive or negative rep btw; only layering of rep's on top of each other so no matter how many "good" ppl you are

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

or how many professional jobs you earn, a role unchecked will still land you squarely in a fight with a stereotype)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Unchecked it's not just the mammy she has to run from but all them other ones too. AND? THEY CAN COMPOSITE ON EACH OTHER.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

So, as I frequently say, if she ain't having those writers THINK ab her and the history of someone as her when writing? It's gonna recirc.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

And it may not recirc as mammy but there are plenty other ways Black women have been viewed that are just as problematic.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Also, section where Nowalk describes her "pushing" him for the character to be more vulnerable. It READS as her asking him for complexity

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

(I looked at it hoping it meant at night she got to snatch off the wig bc of the commentary on "taking off the makeup" and such…I doubt it.)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

His reluctance speaks to two things: if he makes her "messy" in a normalized (read: white) role she subsumes, it will play "stereotype."

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Other thing: He doesn't know how to write complexity on a Black body and VD won't push him THAT specifically when she pushes.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Last thing ab the role: VD is right. This role will mean a different thing than what it does for Kerry bc of her hue. But selling it as if

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

it's the most normal thing in the world and you're the weird one for assuming it ain't is the business of Shondaland.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

It's gonna be DIFFERENT watching a dark skinned Black lady get her sexytime w men on tv. It is. And we should feel quite okay saying that.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

2. I'll leave Shonda's ridiculous ass for last bc there's no point in losing my cool this early. Let's chat for a few bars ab Viola.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

So it seems very clear that Viola is doing some very strategic work here in this interview. She must at once be grateful, (mildly) critical

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

(although as I have learned this weekend sometimes mild criticism still feels like lye on the bodies of white execs so…)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

while indicting NO ONE of importance (this is KEY) and entrepreneurial all at the same damn time. It's a tough job. I think BW have to do

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

some measure of that in every day life so it's not extraordinary that she does it. It's extraordinary she actually believes it a little.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

But, look, there is a certain amount of buy-in that goes with the job, so, we'll live.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

The problem is this NYT article was likely an interview from a few weeks back & we now have her soft peddling response on Buzzfeed thing.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

What does she say? Essentially she as a dark skinned Black woman has been relegated to essentially the same 5 parts (the fault of no one)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

and that while she creates a rich and multifaceted backstory for each character (this shows off training & skill btw) what ends up on screen

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

is…a wonderful actress trying to make a house dress a ball gown. Fine. Work is work actors tell me.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

I mean line one of the piece is I dig into the fried chicken special of the day like it's filet mignon.

Shrugs.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Listen all the things she said in NYT piece she now has somehow been told she has to defang a little by the time she gets to Buzzfeed thing.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

By Buzzfeed the strand of trepidation that runs between her and KW ab discussing the importance of the Black bodies in non-Black roles.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

So much so that Ellen "she ain't got no damn worries" Pompeo has to say what they can't. So the contrast bw NYT and Buzz interesting.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

What does this mean? That she is at once trying to be grateful, mildly critical while indicting no one (whose at fault for not allowing

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

BW to find work beyond scope of those 5 parts she's played? No one in particular. Or: society. Not execs, writers, Hollywood power. Nope.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

And could she even say that in the first place and still maintain mild criticism and gratitude??

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

She even tries to not put Black women's plight against white women over 40. Look at her ass trying to not make this a big deal when it is.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Though she did imply a minor indictment on one population: Black folks. She says we didn't see The Help bc we wanted to see Spiderman.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Bc that's what those big debates during the film's run were about. Black folks preferring Spiderman.

You aim where the hit won't matter.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

(And she knows that we'll take the hit bc above all we understand she needed the release valve and it was us. Shrugs)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Last thought before I finally move on to side-eyein'g Shonda: the most revealing section of the piece for me was "The List." It's not just

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

that she has never been in a position to ask for specific things she "needs" to make her a better actress, it's (my gut) that she prolly

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

assumes asking for things she "needs" (and let's be clear it's not needs to desire a massage or a 6 pack of Greek yogurt) would relegate her

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

right back around to a racialized trope. Bc when in history have we seen Black women be treated well bc they deserved it?

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

On Oprah it's so excessive we elide her indulgences because if we knew how deep it went it'd hurt.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Here's the Buzzfeed thing. I couldn't get through it all bc stabby: http://t.co/VnxdNS191g

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

3) Lastly Shonda. You all know my feelings about Ms. Rhimes. I always hope and pray that she is saying all that BS so she can keep moving

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

(although at what cost she moves is always on the table) and not because she actually believes it.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

Yet and still: she will always be the one to make strange that race is still an issue in America and the world. Despite Ferguson and all

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

the other things that have happened of late. I know she tweeted during Ferguson but y'all her dissonance knows no bounds.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

While some Black folk may applaud Shonda's caustic reluctance to deal with race in her world as a THING; you know I hate that shit. So...

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

this is why I'm perfectly sure that we're gonna have some issues with the Black lady named Analise Keating.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

And, yes, as @frittersandclam mentioned: the way Rhimes tries to invite Davis into the "List" club feels as dangerous to me as to Davis.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

4) Oh, oh, oh…the article itself: the warmed over recitation of why never really indicted Hollywood doesn't make Black films often:

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014

It's the world's fault. The world (over there) doesn't watch Black films. Ergo we don't make them bc we need overseas tickets to break even.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) September 15, 2014
